str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A spectacle, vision, that which is seen. From horao; something gazed at, i.e. A spectacle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Of Hebrew origin; Ananias, the name of three Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To put, place upon, lay on; I add, give in addition. From epi and tithemi; to impose.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From hos and pos; what(-ever) how, i.e. In the manner that (as adverb or conjunction of coincidence, intentional or actual).

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To look up, recover my sight. From ana and blepo; to look up; by implication, to recover sight.
